result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Richard Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn Richard Stewart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn Richard Stewart was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to sign up for Probation by 3:30 p.m. on 03/25/22.
- Court notes 5 days jail credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs of $243.00. Bond on file to apply. Balance to be paid through Probation.
DNA Surcharge of $200.00.

- DNA Sample.
- Cooperate with any evaluation, assessment, and/or correctional program as directed by the DOC Agent.
- Absolute Sobriety only during placement with child.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol only during placement with child.
- Shall only use prescription medications if prescribed by a physician and only in the amounts prescribed. 
- Shall not possess or consume any illegal drugs at during placement with child.
- No abusive contact with Brody P. and Jadyn S. 
- Random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
- Follow all rules and regulations of Agent. 
- Pay supervision fees.

02:30 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Shawn Richard Stewart appeared. Court reviews case. Atty Chapman recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct- 947.01(1). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Victim rights are complied with. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Court dismisses Count 1. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: W/S 1 Year Probation

- 25 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample 
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessement, and/or correctional program as directed by probation and complete any recommended treatment successfully. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. During time of placement of Child. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. During time of placement of Child. 
- No Abusive Contact with Brody P. and Jadyn S. 
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km
Status conference on January 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.B.S. or B.D.P.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
